text: Political liberty, the peace of a nation, and science itself are gifts for which Fate demands a heavy tax in blood!
author: Honore de Balzac

text: As long as man continues to be the ruthless destroyer of lower living beings he will never know health or peace. For as long as men massacre animals, they will kill each other.
author: Pythagoras

text: Let's drink to the spirit of gallantry and courage that made a strange Heaven out of unbelievable Hell, and let's drink to the hope that one day this country of ours, which we love so much, will find dignity and greatness and peace again.
author: Noel Coward

text: Work and live to serve others, to leave the world a little better than you found it and garner for yourself as much peace of mind as you can. This is happiness.
author: David Sarnoff

text: Children are God's Apostles, sent forth, day by day, to preach of love, and hope, and peace.
author: James Russell Lowell
